title: Get started with Cloud Cost Reporting
content:
Cloud Cost Reporting provides enterprises with clear visibility into their cloud spending through interactive, dynamic reports. It helps enterprises monitor costs and make informed decisions to improve return on investment (ROI) and enforce accountability.

How Cloud Cost Reporting works

Cloud Cost Reporting depends on Operations Platform for data storage and reporting. 

Cloud Management retrieves billing data and cloud account information from your cloud environments. Operations Platform stores the billing data and provides reporting capabilities to analyze cloud spending.

Operations Platform components used by Cloud Cost Reporting

Cloud Cost Reporting relies on the following components within Operations Platform to store data and display reports:

  • OPTIC Data Lake - Stores the billing data collected by Cloud Management. This data is stored in Vertica, the analytics database used by OPTIC Data Lake.
  • Operations Cloud - Provides the reporting interface where to create and view reports.
  • Identity Manager (IdM) - Manages user authentication and the roles that control access to reports and reporting features in Operations Cloud.

Key concepts

Cloud cost data providers

A cloud cost data provider represents a connection between the Cloud Management application and your cloud platform. Cloud Management uses this connection to retrieve billing data from the cloud platform.

Supported cloud cost data providers

Cloud Cost Reporting supports billing data collection and reporting for the following cloud platforms:

  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • Microsoft Azure
  • Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI)

Billing data is collected periodically and stored in OPTIC Data Lake. Collections run automatically and can also be triggered on demand. For more information, see Cloud Cost Data Providers.

Cloud accounts

A cloud account represents an account that exists within one of the cloud platforms supported by Cloud Cost Reporting (AWS, Azure, and OCI). Cloud Management retrieves and maintains cloud account information so you can view all accounts in one place and track who owns and manages each account.

Cloud platforms may use different names for their account structures, but these accounts serve the same purpose: they act as containers for cloud resources and exist at levels in the cloud platform hierarchy where billing is generated. For this reason, cloud accounts form the foundation for Cloud Cost Reporting.

Cloud Cost Reporting supports two scopes of cloud accounts: root accounts and member accounts. These scopes correspond to the highest and lowest levels of account hierarchy within a cloud platform and allow reporting at different levels of detail.

Key features

View and manage cloud accounts

Cloud Cost Reporting retrieves cloud account information from your cloud environments and makes it available in Cloud Management. For more information, see Cloud Operations.

Use prebuilt Cloud Cost Reports

OpenText provides the Cloud Cost Reports package. After you upload this package into Operations Platform, a set of prebuilt reports becomes available in Operations Cloud. These reports cover key areas of cloud spending and can be customized or extended as needed. They are provided so you do not have to create reports from scratch.

For details about the reports, see Cloud Cost Reports.

Create custom reports

In addition to the prebuilt reports, you can create your own custom reports in Operations Cloud to meet additional reporting needs.

For steps to create custom reports, see Create a Flex report.

Setup for Cloud Cost Reporting

The following table outlines the complete setup process:

Step Description User
1. Install the suite with Cloud Cost Reporting Install the Cloud Cost Reporting capability when installing the suite as an add-on capability. As a prerequisite, install the OO and DND capabilities for the proper functioning of Cloud Cost Reporting. See Install on-premises, Install on AWS, Install on Azure, Install on OpenShift, Install on BYOK, and Install add-on capabilities. Suite admin
2. Install Operations Platform

Install Operations Platform. See Install Operations Platform.

Operations Platform administrator

3. Install and configure Vertica

Install and configure Vertica for Cloud Cost Reporting. See Install Vertica.

Operations Platform administrator

4. Create Cloud Management tenant

Create a Cloud Management tenant and assign the appropriate licenses. See Set up a tenant.

Suite admin

5. Create Operations Platform tenant

Create a tenant in Operations Platform. See Tenant Management.

SUPER_IDM_ADMIN 

6. Enable Cloud Cost Reporting in the Cloud Management tenant

Deploy and enable the Cloud Cost Reporting capability. As a prerequisite, enable the OO and DND capabilities. See Enable OO Containerized, Enable DND, and Enable Cloud Cost Reporting.

Suite admin

7. Download the Cloud Cost Reports package

Download the Cloud Cost Reports package. This package provides prebuilt Cloud Cost Reports and the FinOps schema. See Download Cloud Cost Reports Package.

NA

8. Upload the Cloud Cost Reports package in Operations Platform

Use the OP-TMS-CLI tool to upload the Cloud Cost Reports package. See Upload UI Services reports to a tenant.

bvd_admin

9. Configure authorization for Cloud Cost Reporting

Configure the roles and groups required to use Cloud Cost Reporting in both Cloud Management and Operations Cloud. See Configure authorization for Cloud Cost Reporting.

Tenant admin of the Cloud Management tenant and SUPER_IDM_ADMIN in Operations Cloud

10. Configure cloud cost providers in Cloud Management

Configure cloud cost data providers to retrieve billing and account data. See Cloud Cost Data Providers.

Cloud integration administrator

11. Manage cloud accounts in Cloud Management

View the status and ownership of the cloud accounts, update an account's primary, secondary, and group ownership, and make a real-time decision against any adverse condition if they know the account's owner. See Cloud operations.

Cloud cost administrator

12. View Cloud Cost Reports and create custom reports

View the prebuilt Cloud Cost Reports in Operations Cloud, and create custom reports as needed. See Cloud Cost Reports.

DefaultBVDRole for viewing the prebuilt reports and bvd_admin for creating custom reports.
